text: No worries Paulina, I also moved house recently so I can relate with being busy haha! :house_with_garden:

Well done on surviving your first year at Uni! I'm really glad you've had a chance to make good friends too in amongst all the madness of learning the language and coping with workload.
I am still very close friends with the people I studied with at University, and I have even had the opportunity to work with them in my career!
I can type up a little more about my pathway into the industry through the week... :blush:
That sounds great about you sending me your works in progress, I'd be more than happy to offer some feedback on that!

And great job on getting started early with your group project!
Your idea of the magician monkey sounds fab too - really solid idea for a student project. Sometimes people go a bit overboard with lots of VFX and explosions, collapsing buildings etc. which is very hard to pull off - but you have a great opportunity here to show off nice and tight CFX/comp skills.
I would love to see any WIPs of your monkey (or lioness sculpt)! :monkey::lion_face:

For me personally, there were some opportunities to learn Houdini at Framestore, however it only ended up being the seniors that used it within the pipeline - so I don't actually have any experience rigging or simulating in Houdini.
But I can shoot some questions to my colleagues still at Framestore if you come up against any difficulties with it!
We typically used Maya for pretty much everything. Although it's a version of Maya that we had padded out with tons of proprietary tools that Framestore's R&D team and senior CFX artists had developed. Each department at Framestore has it's own shelf of tools, so it was only possible to learn the workflow from within the company - there are no tutorials online for the work we were doing

Don't let this put you off though, it just means you need to be comfortable with learning on the job. And don't worry too much about knowing the technical stuff 100% - it's your ability to show off good anatomical knowledge and having creative vision that the recruiters are looking for!
You might find this video interesting:  <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_JQ673B6Y70>

text: Hope you enjoy the rest of your time before term starts again! Catch you soon :wave:
